raft_interface_layers.description: The number of layers between the base and the surface of the raft. These comprise the main thickness of the raft. Increasing this creates a thicker, sturdier raft.
raft_interface_layers.label: Raft Middle Layers

raft_interface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the middle raft layer. The spacing of the middle should be quite wide, while being dense enough to support the top raft layers.
raft_interface_line_spacing.label: Raft Middle Spacing

raft_interface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the middle raft layer. Making the second layer extrude more causes the lines to stick to the build plate.
raft_interface_line_width.label: Raft Middle Line Width

raft_interface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the middle raft layer.
raft_interface_thickness.label: Raft Middle Thickness

raft_base_jerk.description: The jerk with which the base raft layer is printed.
raft_base_jerk.label: Raft Base Print Jerk

raft_interface_jerk.description: The jerk with which the middle raft layer is printed.
raft_interface_jerk.label: Raft Middle Print Jerk

raft_surface_jerk.description: The jerk with which the top raft layers are printed.
raft_surface_jerk.label: Raft Top Print Jerk

raft_jerk.description: The jerk with which the raft is printed.
raft_jerk.label: Raft Print Jerk

raft_margin.description: If the raft is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.
raft_margin.label: Raft Extra Margin

raft_smoothing.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.
raft_smoothing.label: Raft Smoothing

raft_base_speed.description: The speed at which the base raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.
raft_base_speed.label: Raft Base Print Speed

raft_interface_speed.description: The speed at which the middle raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.
raft_interface_speed.label: Raft Middle Print Speed

raft_surface_speed.description: The speed at which the top raft layers are printed. These should be printed a bit slower, so that the nozzle can slowly smooth out adjacent surface lines.
raft_surface_speed.label: Raft Top Print Speed

raft_speed.description: The speed at which the raft is printed.
raft_speed.label: Raft Print Speed

raft_surface_layers.description: The number of top layers on top of the 2nd raft layer. These are fully filled layers that the model sits on. 2 layers result in a smoother top surface than 1.
raft_surface_layers.label: Raft Top Layers

raft_surface_line_spacing.description: The distance between the raft lines for the top raft layers. The spacing should be equal to the line width, so that the surface is solid.
raft_surface_line_spacing.label: Raft Top Spacing

raft_surface_line_width.description: Width of the lines in the top surface of the raft. These can be thin lines so that the top of the raft becomes smooth.
raft_surface_line_width.label: Raft Top Line Width

raft_surface_thickness.description: Layer thickness of the top raft layers.
raft_surface_thickness.label: Raft Top Layer Thickness

skirt_brim_minimal_length.description: The minimum length of the skirt or brim. If this length is not reached by all skirt or brim lines together, more skirt or brim lines will be added until the minimum length is reached. Note: If the line count is set to 0 this is ignored.
skirt_brim_minimal_length.label: Skirt/Brim Minimum Length

skirt_gap.description:
The horizontal distance between the skirt and the first layer of the print.
This is the minimum distance. Multiple skirt lines will extend outwards from this distance.
skirt_gap.label: Skirt Distance

skirt_line_count.description: Multiple skirt lines help to prime your extrusion better for small models. Setting this to 0 will disable the skirt.
skirt_line_count.label: Skirt Line Count

initial_layer_line_width_factor.description: Multiplier of the line width on the first layer. Increasing this could improve bed adhesion.
initial_layer_line_width_factor.label: Initial Layer Line Width

layer_height.description: The height of each layer in mm. Higher values produce faster prints in lower resolution, lower values produce slower prints in higher resolution.
layer_height.label: Layer Height

layer_height_0.description: The height of the initial layer in mm. A thicker initial layer makes adhesion to the build plate easier.
layer_height_0.label: Initial Layer Height

infill_line_width.description: Width of a single infill line.
infill_line_width.label: Infill Line Width

prime_tower_line_width.description: Width of a single prime tower line.
prime_tower_line_width.label: Prime Tower Line Width

skin_line_width.description: Width of a single top/bottom line.
skin_line_width.label: Top/Bottom Line Width

skirt_brim_line_width.description: Width of a single skirt or brim line.
skirt_brim_line_width.enabled: resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('prime_tower_brim_enable') or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled')
skirt_brim_line_width.label: Skirt/Brim Line Width

support_bottom_line_width.description: Width of a single support floor line.
support_bottom_line_width.label: Support Floor Line Width

support_roof_line_width.description: Width of a single support roof line.
support_roof_line_width.label: Support Roof Line Width

support_interface_line_width.description: Width of a single line of support roof or floor.
support_interface_line_width.label: Support Interface Line Width

support_line_width.description: Width of a single support structure line.
support_line_width.label: Support Line Width

wall_line_width_0.description: Width of the outermost wall line. By lowering this value, higher levels of detail can be printed.
wall_line_width_0.label: Outer Wall Line Width

wall_line_width_x.description: Width of a single wall line for all wall lines except the outermost one.
wall_line_width_x.label: Inner Wall(s) Line Width

wall_line_width.description: Width of a single wall line.
wall_line_width.label: Wall Line Width

line_width.description: Width of a single line. Generally, the width of each line should correspond to the width of the nozzle. However, slightly reducing this value could produce better prints.
line_width.label: Line Width

resolution.description: All settings that influence the resolution of the print. These settings have a large impact on the quality (and print time)
resolution.label: Quality

alternate_extra_perimeter.description: Prints an extra wall at every other layer. This way infill gets caught between these extra walls, resulting in stronger prints.
alternate_extra_perimeter.label: Alternate Extra Wall

fill_outline_gaps.description: Print pieces of the model which are horizontally thinner than the nozzle size.
fill_outline_gaps.label: Print Thin Walls

hole_xy_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all holes in each layer. Positive values increase the size of the holes, negative values reduce the size of the holes.
hole_xy_offset.label: Hole Horizontal Expansion

inset_direction.description: Determines the order in which walls are printed. Printing outer walls earlier helps with dimensional accuracy, as faults from inner walls cannot propagate to the outside. However printing them later allows them to stack better when overhangs are printed. When there is an uneven amount of total innner walls, the 'center last line' is always printed last.
inset_direction.label: Wall Ordering

min_bead_width.description: Width of the wall that will replace thin features (according to the Minimum Feature Size) of the model. If the Minimum Wall Line Width is thinner than the thickness of the feature, the wall will become as thick as the feature itself.
min_bead_width.label: Minimum Thin Wall Line Width

min_feature_size.description: Minimum thickness of thin features. Model features that are thinner than this value will not be printed, while features thicker than the Minimum Feature Size will be widened to the Minimum Wall Line Width.
min_feature_size.label: Minimum Feature Size

min_even_wall_line_width.description: The minimum line width for normal polygonal walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing a single thin wall line, to printing two wall lines. A higher Minimum Even Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum odd wall line width. The maximum even wall line width is calculated as Outer Wall Line Width + 0.5 * Minimum Odd Wall Line Width.
min_even_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Even Wall Line Width

min_odd_wall_line_width.description: The minimum line width for middle line gap filler polyline walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing two wall lines, to printing two outer walls and a single central wall in the middle. A higher Minimum Odd Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum even wall line width. The maximum odd wall line width is calculated as 2 * Minimum Even Wall Line Width.
min_odd_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Odd Wall Line Width

min_wall_line_width.description: For thin structures around once or twice the nozzle size, the line widths need to be altered to adhere to the thickness of the model. This setting controls the minimum line width allowed for the walls. The minimum line widths inherently also determine the maximum line widths, since we transition from N to N+1 walls at some geometry thickness where the N walls are wide and the N+1 walls are narrow. The widest possible wall line is twice the Minimum Wall Line Width.
min_wall_line_width.label: Minimum Wall Line Width

optimize_wall_printing_order.description: Optimize the order in which walls are printed so as to reduce the number of retractions and the distance travelled. Most parts will benefit from this being enabled but some may actually take longer so please compare the print time estimates with and without optimization. First layer is not optimized when choosing brim as build plate adhesion type.
optimize_wall_printing_order.label: Optimize Wall Printing Order

wall_0_inset.description: Inset applied to the path of the outer wall. If the outer wall is smaller than the nozzle, and printed after the inner walls, use this offset to get the hole in the nozzle to overlap with the inner walls instead of the outside of the model.
wall_0_inset.label: Outer Wall Inset
wall_0_inset.value: (machine_nozzle_size - wall_line_width_0) / 2 if (wall_line_width_0 < machine_nozzle_size and inset_direction != "outside_in") else 0

wall_0_wipe_dist.description: Distance of a travel move inserted after the outer wall, to hide the Z seam better.
wall_0_wipe_dist.label: Outer Wall Wipe Distance

wall_distribution_count.description: The number of walls, counted from the center, over which the variation needs to be spread. Lower values mean that the outer walls don't change in width.
wall_distribution_count.label: Wall Distribution Count

wall_0_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the outer wall. This is used in multi-extrusion.
wall_0_extruder_nr.label: Outer Wall Extruder

wall_x_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the inner walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.
wall_x_extruder_nr.label: Inner Wall Extruder

wall_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.
wall_extruder_nr.label: Wall Extruder

wall_line_count.description: The number of walls. When calculated by the wall thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.
wall_line_count.label: Wall Line Count
wall_line_count.value: 1 if magic_spiralize else max(1, round((wall_thickness - wall_line_width_0) / wall_line_width_x) + 1) if wall_thickness != 0 else 0

wall_thickness.description: The thickness of the walls in the horizontal direction. This value divided by the wall line width defines the number of walls.
wall_thickness.label: Wall Thickness

wall_transition_angle.description: When to create transitions between even and odd numbers of walls. A wedge shape with an angle greater than this setting will not have transitions and no walls will be printed in the center to fill the remaining space. Reducing this setting reduces the number and length of these center walls, but may leave gaps or overextrude.
wall_transition_angle.label: Wall Transitioning Threshold Angle

wall_transition_filter_deviation.description: Prevent transitioning back and forth between one extra wall and one less. This margin extends the range of line widths which follow to [Minimum Wall Line Width - Margin, 2 * Minimum Wall Line Width + Margin]. Increasing this margin reduces the number of transitions, which reduces the number of extrusion starts/stops and travel time. However, large line width variation can lead to under- or overextrusion problems.
wall_transition_filter_deviation.label: Wall Transitioning Filter Margin

wall_transition_filter_distance.description: If it would be transitioning back and forth between different numbers of walls in quick succession, don't transition at all. Remove transitions if they are closer together than this distance.
wall_transition_filter_distance.label: Wall Transitioning Filter Distance

wall_transition_length.description: When transitioning between different numbers of walls as the part becomes thinner, a certain amount of space is allotted to split or join the wall lines.
wall_transition_length.label: Wall Transition Length

xy_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in each layer. Positive values can compensate for too big holes; negative values can compensate for too small holes.
xy_offset.label: Horizontal Expansion

xy_offset_layer_0.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in the first layer. A negative value can compensate for squishing of the first layer known as "elephant's foot".
xy_offset_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Horizontal Expansion

z_seam_corner.description: Control whether corners on the model outline influence the position of the seam. None means that corners have no influence on the seam position. Hide Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an inside corner. Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an outside corner. Hide or Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur at an inside or outside corner. Smart Hiding allows both inside and outside corners, but chooses inside corners more frequently, if appropriate.
z_seam_corner.label: Seam Corner Preference

z_seam_x.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.
z_seam_x.label: Z Seam X
z_seam_x.value: (0 if (z_seam_position == 'frontleft' or z_seam_position == 'left' or z_seam_position == 'backleft') else machine_width / 2 if (z_seam_position == 'front' or z_seam_position == 'back') else machine_width) - (machine_width / 2 if z_seam_relative or machine_center_is_zero else 0)

z_seam_y.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.
z_seam_y.label: Z Seam Y
z_seam_y.value: (0 if (z_seam_position == 'frontleft' or z_seam_position == 'front' or z_seam_position == 'frontright') else machine_depth / 2 if (z_seam_position == 'left' or z_seam_position == 'right') else machine_depth) - (machine_depth / 2 if z_seam_relative or machine_center_is_zero else 0)

z_seam_position.description: The position near where to start printing each part in a layer.
z_seam_position.label: Z Seam Position

z_seam_relative.description: When enabled, the z seam coordinates are relative to each part's centre. When disabled, the coordinates define an absolute position on the build plate.
z_seam_relative.label: Z Seam Relative

z_seam_type.description: Starting point of each path in a layer. When paths in consecutive layers start at the same point a vertical seam may show on the print. When aligning these near a user specified location, the seam is easiest to remove. When placed randomly the inaccuracies at the paths' start will be less noticeable. When taking the shortest path the print will be quicker.
z_seam_type.label: Z Seam Alignment

acceleration_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the print head acceleration. Increasing the accelerations can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.
acceleration_enabled.label: Enable Acceleration Control

acceleration_print_layer_0.description: The acceleration during the printing of the initial layer.
acceleration_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Acceleration

acceleration_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.
acceleration_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Acceleration

acceleration_layer_0.description: The acceleration for the initial layer.
acceleration_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Acceleration

acceleration_infill.description: The acceleration with which infill is printed.
acceleration_infill.label: Infill Acceleration

acceleration_prime_tower.description: The acceleration with which the prime tower is printed.
acceleration_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Acceleration

acceleration_roofing.description: The acceleration with which top surface skin layers are printed.
acceleration_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Acceleration

acceleration_support_infill.description: The acceleration with which the infill of support is printed.
acceleration_support_infill.label: Support Infill Acceleration

acceleration_support_bottom.description: The acceleration with which the floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.
acceleration_support_bottom.enabled: acceleration_enabled and support_bottom_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
acceleration_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Acceleration

acceleration_support_roof.description: The acceleration with which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.
acceleration_support_roof.enabled: acceleration_enabled and support_roof_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
acceleration_support_roof.label: Support Roof Acceleration

acceleration_support_interface.description: The acceleration with which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.
acceleration_support_interface.enabled: resolveOrValue('acceleration_enabled') and support_interface_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
acceleration_support_interface.label: Support Interface Acceleration

acceleration_support.description: The acceleration with which the support structure is printed.
acceleration_support.label: Support Acceleration

acceleration_topbottom.description: The acceleration with which top/bottom layers are printed.
acceleration_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Acceleration

acceleration_wall_0.description: The acceleration with which the outermost walls are printed.
acceleration_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Acceleration

acceleration_wall_x.description: The acceleration with which all inner walls are printed.
acceleration_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Acceleration

acceleration_wall.description: The acceleration with which the walls are printed.
acceleration_wall.label: Wall Acceleration

acceleration_print.description: The acceleration with which printing happens.
acceleration_print.label: Print Acceleration

acceleration_skirt_brim.description: The acceleration with which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done with the initial layer acceleration, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different acceleration.
acceleration_skirt_brim.enabled: resolveOrValue('acceleration_enabled') and (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled'))
acceleration_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Acceleration

acceleration_travel.description: The acceleration with which travel moves are made.
acceleration_travel.label: Travel Acceleration

acceleration_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate acceleration rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the acceleration value of the printed line at their destination.
acceleration_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Acceleration

jerk_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the jerk of print head when the velocity in the X or Y axis changes. Increasing the jerk can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.
jerk_enabled.label: Enable Jerk Control

jerk_print_layer_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change during the printing of the initial layer.
jerk_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Jerk

jerk_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.
jerk_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Jerk

jerk_layer_0.description: The print maximum instantaneous velocity change for the initial layer.
jerk_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Jerk

jerk_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which infill is printed.
jerk_infill.label: Infill Jerk

jerk_prime_tower.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the prime tower is printed.
jerk_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Jerk

jerk_roofing.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top surface skin layers are printed.
jerk_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Jerk

jerk_support_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the infill of support is printed.
jerk_support_infill.label: Support Infill Jerk

jerk_support_bottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the floors of support are printed.
jerk_support_bottom.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_bottom_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
jerk_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Jerk

jerk_support_roof.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs of support are printed.
jerk_support_roof.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_roof_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
jerk_support_roof.label: Support Roof Jerk

jerk_support_interface.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs and floors of support are printed.
jerk_support_interface.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_interface_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)
jerk_support_interface.label: Support Interface Jerk

jerk_support.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the support structure is printed.
jerk_support.label: Support Jerk

jerk_topbottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top/bottom layers are printed.
jerk_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Jerk

jerk_wall_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the outermost walls are printed.
jerk_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Jerk

jerk_wall_x.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which all inner walls are printed.
jerk_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Jerk

jerk_wall.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the walls are printed.
jerk_wall.label: Wall Jerk

jerk_print.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change of the print head.
jerk_print.label: Print Jerk

jerk_skirt_brim.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the skirt and brim are printed.
jerk_skirt_brim.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled'))
jerk_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Jerk

jerk_travel.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which travel moves are made.
jerk_travel.label: Travel Jerk

jerk_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate jerk rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the jerk value of the printed line at their destination.
jerk_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Jerk

skirt_brim_speed.description: The speed at which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done at the initial layer speed, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different speed.
skirt_brim_speed.enabled: resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled')
skirt_brim_speed.label: Skirt/Brim Speed

speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.description: Extrusion width based correction factor on the speed. At 0% the movement speed is kept constant at the Print Speed. At 100% the movement speed is adjusted so that the flow (in mm³/s) is kept constant, i.e. lines half the normal Line Width are printed twice as fast and lines twice as wide are printed half as fast. A value larger than 100% can help to compensate for the higher pressure required to extrude wide lines.
speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.label: Flow Equalization Ratio

speed_print_layer_0.description: The speed of printing for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.
speed_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Speed

speed_travel_layer_0.description: The speed of travel moves in the initial layer. A lower value is advised to prevent pulling previously printed parts away from the build plate. The value of this setting can automatically be calculated from the ratio between the Travel Speed and the Print Speed.
speed_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Speed

speed_layer_0.description: The speed for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate. Does not affect the build plate adhesion structures themselves, like brim and raft.
speed_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Speed

speed_infill.description: The speed at which infill is printed.
speed_infill.label: Infill Speed

speed_prime_tower.description: The speed at which the prime tower is printed. Printing the prime tower slower can make it more stable when the adhesion between the different filaments is suboptimal.
speed_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Speed

speed_roofing.description: The speed at which top surface skin layers are printed.
speed_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Speed

speed_support_infill.description: The speed at which the infill of support is printed. Printing the infill at lower speeds improves stability.
speed_support_infill.label: Support Infill Speed

speed_support_bottom.description: The speed at which the floor of support is printed. Printing it at lower speed can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.
speed_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Speed

speed_support_roof.description: The speed at which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.
speed_support_roof.label: Support Roof Speed

speed_support_interface.description: The speed at which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.
speed_support_interface.label: Support Interface Speed

speed_support.description: The speed at which the support structure is printed. Printing support at higher speeds can greatly reduce printing time. The surface quality of the support structure is not important since it is removed after printing.
speed_support.label: Support Speed

speed_topbottom.description: The speed at which top/bottom layers are printed.
speed_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Speed

speed_wall_0.description: The speed at which the outermost walls are printed. Printing the outer wall at a lower speed improves the final skin quality. However, having a large difference between the inner wall speed and the outer wall speed will affect quality in a negative way.
speed_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Speed

speed_wall_x.description: The speed at which all inner walls are printed. Printing the inner wall faster than the outer wall will reduce printing time. It works well to set this in between the outer wall speed and the infill speed.
speed_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Speed

speed_wall.description: The speed at which the walls are printed.
speed_wall.label: Wall Speed

speed_print.description: The speed at which printing happens.
speed_print.label: Print Speed

speed_slowdown_layers.description: The first few layers are printed slower than the rest of the model, to get better adhesion to the build plate and improve the overall success rate of prints. The speed is gradually increased over these layers.
speed_slowdown_layers.label: Number of Slower Layers

speed_travel.description: The speed at which travel moves are made.
speed_travel.label: Travel Speed

speed_z_hop.description: The speed at which the vertical Z movement is made for Z Hops. This is typically lower than the print speed since the build plate or machine's gantry is harder to move.
speed_z_hop.label: Z Hop Speed

gradual_support_infill_step_height.description: The height of support infill of a given density before switching to half the density.
gradual_support_infill_step_height.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_infill_rate > 0 and gradual_support_infill_steps > 0
gradual_support_infill_step_height.label: Gradual Support Infill Step Height

gradual_support_infill_steps.description: Number of times to reduce the support infill density by half when getting further below top surfaces. Areas which are closer to top surfaces get a higher density, up to the Support Infill Density.
gradual_support_infill_steps.label: Gradual Support Infill Steps
gradual_support_infill_steps.maximum_value_warning: 1 if (support_pattern == 'cross' or support_pattern == 'lines' or support_pattern == 'concentric') else 5

minimum_bottom_area.description: Minimum area size for the floors of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.
minimum_bottom_area.label: Minimum Support Floor Area

minimum_roof_area.description: Minimum area size for the roofs of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.
minimum_roof_area.label: Minimum Support Roof Area

minimum_interface_area.description: Minimum area size for support interface polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.
minimum_interface_area.label: Minimum Support Interface Area

minimum_support_area.description: Minimum area size for support polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will not be generated.
minimum_support_area.label: Minimum Support Area

support_angle.description: The minimum angle of overhangs for which support is added. At a value of 0° all overhangs are supported, 90° will not provide any support.
support_angle.label: Support Overhang Angle

support_bottom_stair_step_height.description: The height of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures. Set to zero to turn off the stair-like behaviour.
support_bottom_stair_step_height.label: Support Stair Step Height

support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope.description: The minimum slope of the area for stair-stepping to take effect. Low values should make support easier to remove on shallower slopes, but really low values may result in some very counter-intuitive results on other parts of the model.
support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope.label: Support Stair Step Minimum Slope Angle

support_bottom_stair_step_width.description: The maximum width of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures.
support_bottom_stair_step_width.label: Support Stair Step Maximum Width

support_brim_enable.description: Generate a brim within the support infill regions of the first layer. This brim is printed underneath the support, not around it. Enabling this setting increases the adhesion of support to the build plate.
support_brim_enable.label: Enable Support Brim

support_brim_line_count.description: The number of lines used for the support brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.
support_brim_line_count.label: Support Brim Line Count

support_brim_width.description: The width of the brim to print underneath the support. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.
support_brim_width.label: Support Brim Width

support_connect_zigzags.description: Connect the ZigZags. This will increase the strength of the zig zag support structure.
support_connect_zigzags.label: Connect Support ZigZags

support_enable.description: Generate structures to support parts of the model which have overhangs. Without these structures, such parts would collapse during printing.
support_enable.label: Generate Support

support_extruder_nr_layer_0.description: The extruder train to use for printing the first layer of support infill. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_extruder_nr_layer_0.label: First Layer Support Extruder

support_infill_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the infill of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_infill_extruder_nr.label: Support Infill Extruder

support_bottom_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_bottom_extruder_nr.label: Support Floor Extruder

support_roof_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_roof_extruder_nr.label: Support Roof Extruder

support_interface_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs and floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_interface_extruder_nr.label: Support Interface Extruder

support_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train to use for printing the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.
support_extruder_nr.label: Support Extruder

support_fan_enable.description: When enabled, the print cooling fan speed is altered for the skin regions immediately above the support.
support_fan_enable.label: Fan Speed Override

support_infill_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angle 0 degrees.
support_infill_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_pattern != 'concentric' and support_infill_rate > 0
support_infill_angles.label: Support Infill Line Directions

support_initial_layer_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed initial layer support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.
support_initial_layer_line_distance.label: Initial Layer Support Line Distance

support_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.
support_line_distance.label: Support Line Distance
support_line_distance.value: 0 if support_infill_rate == 0 else (support_line_width * 100) / support_infill_rate * (2 if support_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_infill_rate.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.
support_infill_rate.label: Support Density
support_infill_rate.value: 15 if support_enable and support_structure == 'normal' else 0 if support_enable and support_structure == 'tree' else 15

support_infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of support infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.
support_infill_sparse_thickness.label: Support Infill Layer Thickness

support_bottom_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_bottom_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_bottom_enable and support_bottom_pattern != 'concentric'
support_bottom_angles.label: Support Floor Line Directions

support_roof_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_roof_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_roof_enable and support_roof_pattern != 'concentric'
support_roof_angles.label: Support Roof Line Directions

support_interface_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).
support_interface_angles.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_interface_enable and support_interface_pattern != 'concentric'
support_interface_angles.label: Support Interface Line Directions

support_bottom_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support floor lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Floor Density, but can be adjusted separately.
support_bottom_line_distance.label: Support Floor Line Distance
support_bottom_line_distance.value: 0 if support_bottom_density == 0 else (support_bottom_line_width * 100) / support_bottom_density * (2 if support_bottom_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_bottom_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_bottom_density.description: The density of the floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better adhesion of the support on top of the model.
support_bottom_density.label: Support Floor Density

support_roof_line_distance.description: Distance between the printed support roof lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Roof Density, but can be adjusted separately.
support_roof_line_distance.label: Support Roof Line Distance
support_roof_line_distance.value: 0 if support_roof_density == 0 else (support_roof_line_width * 100) / support_roof_density * (2 if support_roof_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_roof_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

support_roof_density.description: The density of the roofs of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.
support_roof_density.label: Support Roof Density

support_interface_density.description: Adjusts the density of the roofs and floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.
support_interface_density.label: Support Interface Density

support_bottom_enable.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the bottom of the support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.
support_bottom_enable.label: Enable Support Floor

support_roof_enable.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the top of support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.
support_roof_enable.label: Enable Support Roof

support_interface_enable.description: Generate a dense interface between the model and the support. This will create a skin at the top of the support on which the model is printed and at the bottom of the support, where it rests on the model.
support_interface_enable.label: Enable Support Interface

support_bottom_height.description: The thickness of the support floors. This controls the number of dense layers that are printed on top of places of a model on which support rests.
support_bottom_height.label: Support Floor Thickness

support_roof_height.description: The thickness of the support roofs. This controls the amount of dense layers at the top of the support on which the model rests.
support_roof_height.label: Support Roof Thickness

support_interface_height.description: The thickness of the interface of the support where it touches with the model on the bottom or the top.
support_interface_height.label: Support Interface Thickness

support_bottom_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the floors of the support.
support_bottom_offset.label: Support Floor Horizontal Expansion

support_roof_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the roofs of the support.
support_roof_offset.label: Support Roof Horizontal Expansion

support_interface_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the support interface polygons.
support_interface_offset.label: Support Interface Horizontal Expansion

support_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern with which the floors of the support are printed.
support_bottom_pattern.label: Support Floor Pattern

support_roof_pattern.description: The pattern with which the roofs of the support are printed.
support_roof_pattern.label: Support Roof Pattern

support_interface_pattern.description: The pattern with which the interface of the support with the model is printed.
support_interface_pattern.label: Support Interface Pattern

support_interface_skip_height.description: When checking where there's model above and below the support, take steps of the given height. Lower values will slice slower, while higher values may cause normal support to be printed in some places where there should have been support interface.
support_interface_skip_height.label: Support Interface Resolution

support_bottom_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface floor. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.
support_bottom_wall_count.label: Support Bottom Wall Line Count

support_roof_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface roof. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.
support_roof_wall_count.label: Support Roof Wall Line Count

support_interface_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.
support_interface_wall_count.label: Support Interface Wall Line Count

support_join_distance.description: The maximum distance between support structures in the X/Y directions. When separate structures are closer together than this value, the structures merge into one.
support_join_distance.label: Support Join Distance

support_mesh_drop_down.description: Make support everywhere below the support mesh, so that there's no overhang in the support mesh.
support_mesh_drop_down.label: Drop Down Support Mesh

support_meshes_present.description: There are support meshes present in the scene. This setting is controlled by Cura.
support_meshes_present.label: Scene Has Support Meshes

support_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all support polygons in each layer. Positive values can smooth out the support areas and result in more sturdy support.
support_offset.label: Support Horizontal Expansion

support_pattern.description: The pattern of the support structures of the print. The different options available result in sturdy or easy to remove support.
support_pattern.label: Support Pattern

support_structure.description: Chooses between the techniques available to generate support. "Normal" support creates a support structure directly below the overhanging parts and drops those areas straight down. "Tree" support creates branches towards the overhanging areas that support the model on the tips of those branches, and allows the branches to crawl around the model to support it from the build plate as much as possible.
support_structure.label: Support Structure

support_supported_skin_fan_speed.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing the skin regions immediately above the support. Using a high fan speed can make the support easier to remove.
support_supported_skin_fan_speed.label: Supported Skin Fan Speed

support_tower_diameter.description: The diameter of a special tower.
support_tower_diameter.label: Tower Diameter

support_tower_maximum_supported_diameter.description: Maximum diameter in the X/Y directions of a small area which is to be supported by a specialized support tower.
support_tower_maximum_supported_diameter.label: Maximum Tower-Supported Diameter

support_tower_roof_angle.description: The angle of a rooftop of a tower. A higher value results in pointed tower roofs, a lower value results in flattened tower roofs.
support_tower_roof_angle.label: Tower Roof Angle

support_tree_angle.description: The angle of the branches. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle to be able to have more reach.
support_tree_angle.label: Tree Support Branch Angle

support_tree_branch_diameter.description: The diameter of the thinnest branches of tree support. Thicker branches are more sturdy. Branches towards the base will be thicker than this.
support_tree_branch_diameter.label: Tree Support Branch Diameter

support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.description: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the tree support.
support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.label: Tree Support Branch Diameter Angle

support_tree_branch_distance.description: How far apart the branches need to be when they touch the model. Making this distance small will cause the tree support to touch the model at more points, causing better overhang but making support harder to remove.
support_tree_branch_distance.label: Tree Support Branch Distance

support_tree_collision_resolution.description: Resolution to compute collisions with to avoid hitting the model. Setting this lower will produce more accurate trees that fail less often, but increases slicing time dramatically.
support_tree_collision_resolution.label: Tree Support Collision Resolution

support_tree_max_diameter.description: The diameter of the widest branches of tree support. A thicker trunk is more sturdy; a thinner trunk takes up less space on the build plate.
support_tree_max_diameter.label: Tree Support Trunk Diameter

support_type.description: Adjusts the placement of the support structures. The placement can be set to touching build plate or everywhere. When set to everywhere the support structures will also be printed on the model.
support_type.label: Support Placement

support_use_towers.description: Use specialized towers to support tiny overhang areas. These towers have a larger diameter than the region they support. Near the overhang the towers' diameter decreases, forming a roof.
support_use_towers.label: Use Towers

support_wall_count.description: The number of walls with which to surround support infill. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.
support_wall_count.label: Support Wall Line Count
support_wall_count.value: 1 if support_enable and support_structure == 'tree' else (1 if (support_pattern == 'grid' or support_pattern == 'triangles' or support_pattern == 'concentric') else 0)

support_xy_distance.description: Distance of the support structure from the print in the X/Y directions.
support_xy_distance.label: Support X/Y Distance

support_xy_distance_overhang.description: Distance of the support structure from the overhang in the X/Y directions.
support_xy_distance_overhang.label: Minimum Support X/Y Distance

support_xy_overrides_z.description: Whether the Support X/Y Distance overrides the Support Z Distance or vice versa. When X/Y overrides Z the X/Y distance can push away the support from the model, influencing the actual Z distance to the overhang. We can disable this by not applying the X/Y distance around overhangs.
support_xy_overrides_z.label: Support Distance Priority

support_bottom_distance.description: Distance from the print to the bottom of the support.
support_bottom_distance.label: Support Bottom Distance
support_bottom_distance.value: extruderValue(support_bottom_extruder_nr if support_bottom_enable else support_infill_extruder_nr, 'support_z_distance') if support_type == 'everywhere' else 0

support_top_distance.description: Distance from the top of the support to the print.
support_top_distance.label: Support Top Distance
support_top_distance.value: extruderValue(support_roof_extruder_nr if support_roof_enable else support_infill_extruder_nr, 'support_z_distance') + (layer_height if support_structure == 'tree' else 0)

support_z_distance.description: Distance from the top/bottom of the support structure to the print. This gap provides clearance to remove the supports after the model is printed. This value is rounded up to a multiple of the layer height.
support_z_distance.label: Support Z Distance

zig_zaggify_support.description: Connect the ends of the support lines together. Enabling this setting can make your support more sturdy and reduce underextrusion, but it will cost more material.
zig_zaggify_support.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and (support_pattern == 'lines' or support_pattern == 'grid' or support_pattern == 'triangles' or support_pattern == 'cross' or support_pattern == 'gyroid')
zig_zaggify_support.label: Connect Support Lines

acceleration_ironing.description: The acceleration with which ironing is performed.
acceleration_ironing.label: Ironing Acceleration

connect_skin_polygons.description: Connect top/bottom skin paths where they run next to each other. For the concentric pattern enabling this setting greatly reduces the travel time, but because the connections can happen midway over infill this feature can reduce the top surface quality.
connect_skin_polygons.enabled: ((top_layers > 0 or bottom_layers > 0) and top_bottom_pattern == 'concentric') or (initial_bottom_layers > 0 and top_bottom_pattern_0 == 'concentric') or (roofing_layer_count > 0 and roofing_pattern == 'concentric')
connect_skin_polygons.label: Connect Top/Bottom Polygons

bottom_skin_expand_distance.description: The distance the bottom skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the skin adhere better to the walls on the layer below. Lower values save amount of material used.
bottom_skin_expand_distance.label: Bottom Skin Expand Distance

top_skin_expand_distance.description: The distance the top skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on the layer above adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.
top_skin_expand_distance.label: Top Skin Expand Distance

expand_skins_expand_distance.description: The distance the skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on neighboring layers adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.
expand_skins_expand_distance.label: Skin Expand Distance

ironing_enabled.description: Go over the top surface one additional time, but this time extruding very little material. This is meant to melt the plastic on top further, creating a smoother surface. The pressure in the nozzle chamber is kept high so that the creases in the surface are filled with material.
ironing_enabled.label: Enable Ironing

ironing_flow.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal skin line, to extrude during ironing. Keeping the nozzle filled helps filling some of the crevices of the top surface, but too much results in overextrusion and blips on the side of the surface.
ironing_flow.label: Ironing Flow

ironing_inset.description: A distance to keep from the edges of the model. Ironing all the way to the edge of the mesh may result in a jagged edge on your print.
ironing_inset.label: Ironing Inset
ironing_inset.value: wall_line_width_0 / 2 + (ironing_line_spacing - skin_line_width * (1.0 + ironing_flow / 100) / 2 if ironing_pattern == 'concentric' else skin_line_width * (1.0 - ironing_flow / 100) / 2)

ironing_line_spacing.description: The distance between the lines of ironing.
ironing_line_spacing.label: Ironing Line Spacing

ironing_monotonic.description: Print ironing lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.
ironing_monotonic.label: Monotonic Ironing Order

ironing_only_highest_layer.description: Only perform ironing on the very last layer of the mesh. This saves time if the lower layers don't need a smooth surface finish.
ironing_only_highest_layer.label: Iron Only Highest Layer

ironing_pattern.description: The pattern to use for ironing top surfaces.
ironing_pattern.label: Ironing Pattern

jerk_ironing.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change while performing ironing.
jerk_ironing.label: Ironing Jerk

min_skin_width_for_expansion.description: Skin areas narrower than this are not expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a slope close to the vertical.
min_skin_width_for_expansion.label: Minimum Skin Width for Expansion

max_skin_angle_for_expansion.description: Top and/or bottom surfaces of your object with an angle larger than this setting, won't have their top/bottom skin expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a near vertical slope. An angle of 0° is horizontal and will cause no skin to be expanded, while an angle of 90° is vertical and will cause all skin to be expanded.
max_skin_angle_for_expansion.label: Maximum Skin Angle for Expansion

roofing_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the top most skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.
roofing_extruder_nr.label: Top Surface Skin Extruder

roofing_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top surface skin layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).
roofing_angles.label: Top Surface Skin Line Directions

roofing_line_width.description: Width of a single line of the areas at the top of the print.
roofing_line_width.label: Top Surface Skin Line Width

roofing_monotonic.description: Print top surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.
roofing_monotonic.label: Monotonic Top Surface Order

roofing_pattern.description: The pattern of the top most layers.
roofing_pattern.label: Top Surface Skin Pattern

roofing_layer_count.description: The number of top most skin layers. Usually only one top most layer is sufficient to generate higher quality top surfaces.
roofing_layer_count.label: Top Surface Skin Layers

skin_angles.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top/bottom layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).
skin_angles.label: Top/Bottom Line Directions

skin_monotonic.description: Print top/bottom lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.
skin_monotonic.label: Monotonic Top/Bottom Order

skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.description: When the model has small vertical gaps of only a few layers, there should normally be skin around those layers in the narrow space. Enable this setting to not generate skin if the vertical gap is very small. This improves printing time and slicing time, but technically leaves infill exposed to the air.
skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic.label: No Skin in Z Gaps

skin_outline_count.description: Replaces the outermost part of the top/bottom pattern with a number of concentric lines. Using one or two lines improves roofs that start on infill material.
skin_outline_count.enabled: (top_layers > 0 or bottom_layers > 0) and (top_bottom_pattern != 'concentric' or top_bottom_pattern_0 != 'concentric' or (roofing_layer_count > 0 and roofing_pattern != 'concentric'))
skin_outline_count.label: Extra Skin Wall Count
skin_outline_count.value: 0 if top_bottom_pattern == 'concentric' and top_bottom_pattern_0 == 'concentric' and roofing_layer_count <= 0 else 1

skin_overlap_mm.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any value over half the width of the wall may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.
skin_overlap_mm.label: Skin Overlap
skin_overlap_mm.value: 0.5 * (skin_line_width + (wall_line_width_x if wall_line_count > 1 else wall_line_width_0)) * skin_overlap / 100 if top_bottom_pattern != 'concentric' else 0

skin_overlap.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines, as a percentage of the line widths of the skin lines and the innermost wall. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any percentage over 50% may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.
skin_overlap.label: Skin Overlap Percentage

bottom_skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of bottom skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.
bottom_skin_preshrink.label: Bottom Skin Removal Width

top_skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of top skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top skin at slanted surfaces in the model.
top_skin_preshrink.label: Top Skin Removal Width

skin_preshrink.description: The largest width of skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top/bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.
skin_preshrink.label: Skin Removal Width

speed_ironing.description: The speed at which to pass over the top surface.
speed_ironing.label: Ironing Speed

top_bottom_extruder_nr.description: The extruder train used for printing the top and bottom skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.
top_bottom_extruder_nr.label: Top/Bottom Extruder

top_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern of the top/bottom layers.
top_bottom_pattern.label: Top/Bottom Pattern

top_bottom_pattern_0.description: The pattern on the bottom of the print on the first layer.
top_bottom_pattern_0.label: Bottom Pattern Initial Layer

bottom_layers.description: The number of bottom layers. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.
bottom_layers.label: Bottom Layers
bottom_layers.value: 999999 if infill_sparse_density == 100 and not magic_spiralize else math.ceil(round(bottom_thickness / resolveOrValue('layer_height'), 4))

initial_bottom_layers.description: The number of initial bottom layers, from the build-plate upwards. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.
initial_bottom_layers.label: Initial Bottom Layers

bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of bottom layers.
bottom_thickness.label: Bottom Thickness

top_layers.description: The number of top layers. When calculated by the top thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.
top_layers.label: Top Layers

top_thickness.description: The thickness of the top layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top layers.
top_thickness.label: Top Thickness

top_bottom_thickness.description: The thickness of the top/bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top/bottom layers.
top_bottom_thickness.label: Top/Bottom Thickness

layer_start_x.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.
layer_start_x.label: Layer Start X

layer_start_y.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.
layer_start_y.label: Layer Start Y

limit_support_retractions.description: Omit retraction when moving from support to support in a straight line. Enabling this setting saves print time, but can lead to excessive stringing within the support structure.
limit_support_retractions.label: Limit Support Retractions

retract_at_layer_change.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving to the next layer.
retract_at_layer_change.label: Retract at Layer Change

retraction_amount.description: The length of material retracted during a retraction move.
retraction_amount.label: Retraction Distance

retraction_combing.description: Combing keeps the nozzle within already printed areas when traveling. This results in slightly longer travel moves but reduces the need for retractions. If combing is off, the material will retract and the nozzle moves in a straight line to the next point. It is also possible to avoid combing over top/bottom skin areas or to only comb within the infill.
retraction_combing.label: Combing Mode
retraction_combing.resolve: 'noskin' if 'noskin' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('infill' if 'infill' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('all' if 'all' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else ('no_outer_surfaces' if 'no_outer_surfaces' in extruderValues('retraction_combing') else 'off')))
retraction_combing.value: 'no_outer_surfaces' if (any(extruderValues('skin_monotonic')) or any(extruderValues('ironing_enabled')) or (any(extruderValues('roofing_monotonic')) and any(extruderValues('roofing_layer_count')))) else 'all'

retraction_combing_max_distance.description: When greater than zero, combing travel moves that are longer than this distance will use retraction. If set to zero, there is no maximum and combing moves will not use retraction.
retraction_combing_max_distance.label: Max Comb Distance With No Retract

retraction_count_max.description: This setting limits the number of retractions occurring within the minimum extrusion distance window. Further retractions within this window will be ignored. This avoids retracting repeatedly on the same piece of filament, as that can flatten the filament and cause grinding issues.
retraction_count_max.label: Maximum Retraction Count

retraction_enable.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving over a non-printed area.
retraction_enable.label: Enable Retraction

retraction_extra_prime_amount.description: Some material can ooze away during a travel move, which can be compensated for here.
retraction_extra_prime_amount.label: Retraction Extra Prime Amount

retraction_extrusion_window.description: The window in which the maximum retraction count is enforced. This value should be approximately the same as the retraction distance, so that effectively the number of times a retraction passes the same patch of material is limited.
retraction_extrusion_window.label: Minimum Extrusion Distance Window

retraction_hop.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop.
retraction_hop.label: Z Hop Height

retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch.description: After the machine switched from one extruder to the other, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. This prevents the nozzle from leaving oozed material on the outside of a print.
retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch.label: Z Hop After Extruder Switch

retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch_hei.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop after extruder switch.
retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch_hei.label: Z Hop After Extruder Switch Height

retraction_hop_enabled.description: Whenever a retraction is done, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. It prevents the nozzle from hitting the print during travel moves, reducing the chance to knock the print from the build plate.
retraction_hop_enabled.label: Z Hop When Retracted

retraction_hop_only_when_collides.description: Only perform a Z Hop when moving over printed parts which cannot be avoided by horizontal motion by Avoid Printed Parts when Traveling.
retraction_hop_only_when_collides.label: Z Hop Only Over Printed Parts

retraction_min_travel.description: The minimum distance of travel needed for a retraction to happen at all. This helps to get fewer retractions in a small area.
retraction_min_travel.label: Retraction Minimum Travel

retraction_prime_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is primed during a retraction move.
retraction_prime_speed.label: Retraction Prime Speed

retraction_retract_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a retraction move.
retraction_retract_speed.label: Retraction Retract Speed

retraction_speed.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted and primed during a retraction move.
retraction_speed.label: Retraction Speed

travel_avoid_distance.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed parts when avoiding during travel moves.
travel_avoid_distance.label: Travel Avoid Distance

travel_avoid_other_parts.description: The nozzle avoids already printed parts when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.
travel_avoid_other_parts.label: Avoid Printed Parts When Traveling

travel_avoid_supports.description: The nozzle avoids already printed supports when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.
travel_avoid_supports.label: Avoid Supports When Traveling

travel_retract_before_outer_wall.description: Always retract when moving to start an outer wall.
travel_retract_before_outer_wall.label: Retract Before Outer Wall
